adjectives.description: crazed (comparative more crazed, superlative most crazed)

examples: The crazed look in his eyes made everyone back away.
He was crazed with thirst and resorted to drinking seawater.

entries.meaning: Covered with cracks (generally applied to porcelain).
examples: The dark traces of the cracks in the crazed surface of the pot contrasted with the light glaze and were quite attractive.

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of craze
